## AlGlobalizer.instantiate() method

Instantiates an instance of a global singleton. This is used primarily to avoid collisions.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
static instantiate<InstanceType>(name: string, factory: {
        (): InstanceType;
    }, collisionHandling?: boolean | string): InstanceType;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  name | <code>string</code> | The symbolic name of the singleton. |
|  factory | <code>{</code><br/><code>        (): InstanceType;</code><br/><code>    }</code> | If the singleton hasn't already been instantiated, this method will be called to generate it. |
|  collisionHandling | <code>boolean &#124; string</code> | If the singleton has already been instantiated, indicates how the collision should be handled. False will ignore the collision; true will generate a warning. A string will cause an exception to be thrown. |

<b>Returns:</b>

`InstanceType`
